abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model trained to perform dexterous manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The model is evaluated on a range of object manipulation tasks, showing strong performance in zero-shot settings.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Touch via Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework that combines vision and tactile feedback to enable dexterous manipulation tasks. The method uses a low-level policy for fine-grained motor control and a high-level policy for task planning, achieving improved performance on complex object manipulation tasks.

title: Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation using Multi-modal Sensor Feedback
abstract: This work explores the use of imitation learning for robotic hand manipulation by leveraging multi-modal sensor data including vision, force, and joint position. The proposed approach demonstrates superior generalization across different objects and environments compared to traditional model-based methods.

abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action planning framework that allows robotic hands to perform dexterous manipulation in unstructured environments by integrating visual perception, language understanding, and action execution.

abstract: This paper proposes a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, where high-level goals are decomposed into low-level motor skills. The model demonstrates improved generalization across different objects and tasks.

abstract: This research focuses on imitating human dexterity using a large-scale imitation learning setup. The model is trained on a diverse set of human hand motions and transferred to robotic systems with minimal fine-tuning.

abstract: We present an optimization-based policy search method for dexterous hand manipulation, combining trajectory optimization with policy gradient techniques. The method achieves better sample efficiency and task success rates compared to traditional RL approaches.

abstract: We propose a hybrid imitation learning framework that combines expert demonstrations with self-supervised exploration to improve the performance of dexterous hand manipulation. title: A Vision-Language-Action Framework for Generalizable Robotic Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a vision-language-action framework that allows robotic systems to perform manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The model is trained on diverse data and shows strong generalization to unseen objects and scenarios.

title: Optimizing Contact Forces for Dexterous Manipulation with Gradient-Based Methods
abstract: This research focuses on optimizing contact forces during dexterous manipulation using gradient-based optimization techniques. The approach improves grasp stability and reduces slipping by adjusting force distributions in real-time.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Deep Reinforcement Learning
abstract: The paper introduces an end-to-end deep reinforcement learning framework for dexterous manipulation. The method learns high-level task goals and low-level motor commands simultaneously, improving performance on complex manipulation tasks without explicit reward shaping.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: This work introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that integrates visual perception, language understanding, and action execution for dexterous hand manipulation. The model can follow natural language instructions to perform complex object manipulation tasks.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: We develop an end-to-end imitation learning system that enables robotic hands to replicate complex human manipulation behaviors. The model is trained on a large dataset of human demonstrations and shows strong generalization across different objects and tasks.

title: Multi-Modal Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: We present a multi-modal imitation learning approach that integrates visual, tactile, and motion data to train dexterous robotic hands. The model learns from diverse sources of human demonstration and achieves robust performance in unstructured environments.

title: Model-Based Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: We present a model-based control framework that uses learned dynamics models to enable precise and efficient control of dexterous robotic hands. The method improves task execution speed and reduces reliance on real-time sensor feedback.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Grasping and Reorientation
abstract: This paper investigates deep reinforcement learning techniques for improving the grasp and reorientation capabilities of robotic hands. The proposed method demonstrates superior performance on challenging object manipulation tasks in dynamic environments.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Action Policies
abstract: We introduce a language-guided vision-action policy that allows robotic hands to perform dexterous manipulation based on natural language instructions. The model effectively combines visual perception and language understanding to execute complex tasks.

title: Dexterous Manipulation via Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning with Goal-conditioned Policies
abstract: We present a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, where goal-conditioned policies are used to break down complex tasks into subtasks. The method improves sample efficiency and task performance compared to traditional RL approaches.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Based Optimization
abstract: This paper presents a model-based optimization approach for controlling dexterous robotic hands, focusing on improving stability and precision during manipulation. The method integrates real-time feedback and optimization to handle dynamic environments.

abstract: We develop an optimization framework tailored for high-dimensional robotic manipulation tasks, focusing on reducing computational overhead while maintaining high task performance. The approach is validated on a realistic dexterous hand setup.

abstract: This paper introduces an adaptive imitation learning method that adjusts the learning process based on the quality of human demonstrations. It is applied to a dexterous robotic hand, achieving successful object manipulation with minimal training data.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation via Human Demonstrations
